Joint measure committee for release of KCTU chairman formed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Joint measure committee for release of KCTU chairman formed in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- More than 30 South Korean citizens' and public organizations including the Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU), the "national catholic priests' council for justice" and the citizens' solidarity for democratic society formed a joint measure committee for the release of KCTU chairman Tan Pyong Ho in Seoul on Oct. 16, according to Yonhap News from Seoul.
 The organizations said that the rearrest  of chairman tan is not a simple matter concerning the labor movement but "a matter related to the morality of the present government as it broke the promise made to the catholic church," and warned that if he is not set free, "they together with people will have no choice but to reveal the immorality of the government and make a positive counteraction."    
 Charging that "government" and prosecution threw away the points agreed with the catholic church like a pair of old shoes to meet their own interests, they strongly demanded his release.

Message of sympathy to premier Hong Song Nam
articles.content:
Message of sympathy to premier Hong Song Nam
    Pyongyang, October 20 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, received a message of sympathy from Russian prime minister M. Kasyanov.
 Noting that Russia received with deep sorrow news that the eastern coastal area of the DPRK was hard hit by typhoon that claimed the loss of human lives and properties, the message expressed deep condolences over it.    
 The Russian people hope that the Korean people will overcome the difficulties by displaying the fortitude and courage peculiar to them, the message said, asking Hong Song Nam to convey consolation and sympathy to the bereaved families of the victims.
